extendedIngredients.name: italian bread
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 thick slices of fresh Italian bread

recipes.title: Creamy White Chicken Grilled Cheese

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.Line baking sheet with aluminium foil and lightly spray with cooking spray.Toss chicken with olive oil, dill, lemon zest, garlic powder, salt and pepper.  Place on baking sheet and bake for 35-40 minutes until cooked through.Allow chicken to cool.  Shred using two forks and place in a medium bowl. In a small bowl stir together cream cheese, dill, garlic powder, onion powder and salt until creamy.  Preheat panini maker or large skillet over medium heat.  Toss Fontina cheese with shredded chicken.  Lightly drizzle outer slices of bread with olive oil or brush with butter.Generously spread inside slices with cream cheese spread.  Top with chicken mixture and other slice of bread.Add sandwich to panini and cook until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown.  If cooking on skillet, flip after a few minutes until golden brown and cheese is melted.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.Line baking sheet with aluminium foil and lightly spray with cooking spray.Toss chicken with olive oil, dill, lemon zest, garlic powder, salt and pepper.

Place on baking sheet and bake for 35-40 minutes until cooked through.Allow chicken to cool.  Shred using two forks and place in a medium bowl. In a small bowl stir together cream cheese, dill, garlic powder, onion powder and salt until creamy.  Preheat panini maker or large skillet over medium heat.  Toss Fontina cheese with shredded chicken.  Lightly drizzle outer slices of bread with olive oil or brush with butter.Generously spread inside slices with cream cheese spread.  Top with chicken mixture and other slice of bread.
Add sandwich to panini and cook until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown.  If cooking on skillet, flip after a few minutes until golden brown and cheese is melted.
